subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Pitcher Chien-Ming Wang and the Yankees avoided salary arbitration when they agreed to a one-year, $5 million contract. Wang, a 28-year-old right-hander, was 8-2 with a 4.07 earned run average in 15 starts last season before injuring a foot while running the bases at Houston in mid-June. He did not return. Wang made $4 million last season after losing in salary arbitration. He had asked for $4.6 million.
